results.title: Milk [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Jane Keneally and Mairi Cameron
results.brief_description: A tenuous friendship is formed between a reclusive older gentleman (Arthur Dignam) and his younger neighbour downstairs (Kris McQuade), with milk providing the fragile link between them.

results.title: Milk
results.creator_credit: Television New Zealand, Martin Didsbury and Denis Harvey
results.brief_description: Shows how conventional dairy processing has been diversified to include such varied products as case in (used in the pharmaceutical and plastics industry) and minipad butter (used in the travel and hospitality industries) and cheescakes. Provides a good insight into the diversity of manufacturing that takes place in a modern dairy.

results.title: Mildura fruit flyer
results.brief_description: A vital link between the fruit growers of Mildura and the markets in Melbourne. In less than 24 hours fruit is picked, sorted, packed and transported by road to the rail yeards, where it is loaded into rail trucks for its express trip to the city markets.
results.description: A vital link between the fruit growers of Mildura and the markets in Melbourne. In less than 24 hours fruit is picked, sorted, packed and transported by road to the rail yeards, where it is loaded into rail trucks for its express trip to the city markets.

results.title: Mildred Pierce
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Jerry Wald and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Joan Crawford earned an Academy Award for her portrayal of Mildred Pierce, a mother who devotes her whole life to her two daughters. When Mildred’s husband turns to another woman for solace, she divorces him and opens a successful restaurant, however, when their eldest daughter’s selfishness gets out of hand, both mother and daughter must face the tragic consequences. Also stars Eve Arden, Ann Blyth, Jack Carson and Zachary Scott.

results.title: Milady
results.brief_description:
Gardefort, a passionate horse trainer at the famous military riding school ‘Le Cadre Noir’ in Saumur prefers to resign after 16 years of exceptional service rather than accept a promotion that would send him away from his beloved horses. He accepts to stay on the school’s purchasing committee. While on an inspection visit, he comes accross Milady, a horse deemed too imperfect for the school, in which he sees riches of potential. What follows could almost be described as a classic tale of ‘amour fou’ between a man who can only exist when riding on horseback and an animal willing to be transformed into the finest executant of the complex range of ‘Haute Ecole’ steps.

Credits: Producer, Denis Mermet ; director, Francois Leterrier ; photography, Georges Leclerc ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Jacques Dufilho, Claude Giraud, Francois Marthouret.

results.title: Mikhali
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Film Producers Guild, British Petroleum, Humphrey Swingler and John Ingram
results.brief_description: A young officer in the Greek Merchant Navy returns to his home on the island of Skiathos to marry his betrothed. Nikos has not seen Maria since she was a rather unattractive teenager, and does not know she has blossomed into the island’s prettiest young woman. Their meeting and the ensuing wedding preparations make a delightful story, superbly photographed in the romantic Greek Islands. Narrated in English, with Greek dialogue.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greenpark Productions, Film Producers Guild, British Petroleum, Humphrey Swingler and John Ingram

results.title: Mikey and Nicky
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Bud Austin and Elaine May
results.brief_description: Screen legends John Cassavetes and Peter Falk are Mikey and Nicky, friends since childhood. Their friendship is forcefully renewed when small-time hood Nicky (Cassavetes), seeks out his friend Mikey (Falk), when he fears there is a hit on him. His suspicions are correct, with hitman Kinney (Ned Beatty) on his tail. When Mikey and Nicky are on the run one witnesses the unravelling of their friendship as suspicion, resentment and betrayal surfaces. Cassavetes and Falk revel in each others performances and there is fine support from Ned Beatty, Rose Arrick and Carol Grace.

results.title: Mike van Diem's character
results.brief_description: Following the death of ruthless baliff Dreverhaven, Jakob, a young lawyer is arrested for his murder. During interrogation he reveals the victim is his father and through a series of flashbacks tells the story of a boy who feels rejected by his family. Based on the novel by Ferdinand Bordewijk. In Dutch with English subtitles.

results.title: Mike Mulligan and his steam shovel [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Morton Schindel
results.brief_description: An iconographic film using the pictures and text of Virginia Lee Burton’s story of the steam shovel that defied obsolescence by becoming the furnace in the Popperville Town Hall. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
